code_value: Space Travel used to be a young man’s game, but when John Glenn went into space aboard Discovery, four generations of men and women could gaze into the sky and think, “That could be me someday.” At the same time, Glenn was looking down and doing some thinking of his own. “It’s quite something,” he said, “to look down on this blue planet, seeing that little film of air that surrounds it. You wonder why in the world humans can’t solve all the problems they’ve created and left uncertain for centuries.”
